collodion:craftinginfo-collodion-text: Collodion Photography This guide walks you through the steps of taking your first wet-plate photograph. 1) Tools & Chemicals Before you can expose any photographs, you'll need some equipment: • Wetplate Camera • Development Tray • Rough Glass Plates • Collodion • A piece of cloth • Silvering Solution • Developer • Fixer 2) Prep Work Your plates need to be prepared in order to become sensitive to light: • Start by using the cloth to polish your plate into a clean glass plate. • Using a bucket, pour the syrupy collodion binder onto the cleaned plate to make it a collodion-coated plate. • Seal the plate in a barrel of silvering solution to receive a silvered plate. With collodion covering the plate, the silvering solution can bind to it, sensitizing the plate to light. 3) Load & Expose • With a silvered plate in your offhand, hold the camera and use shift + rightmousebutton to load the plate into it. • Once you're ready to take a photograph, look through the viewfinder rightmousebutton and use leftmousebutton to expose the plate to light. • Unload the camera the same way to get your newexposed plate. There's still work to do before you can see how it came out. 4) Develop & Fix • Place the exposed plate in your development tray. • As you pour developer onto the plate, you should begin to see the image. • Finish the process by pouring on fixer to stabilize the plate as a finished photo plate. 4) Display • Mount your finished plate in a frame and hang it on your wall to display your work! • Click on the frame with a wooden board to change the frame's material. • You can use writing materials like charcoal to add notes/captions to the photograph.
